comments:
This course works with experimental studies in heat and mass transfer,
separations and chemical reactors to verify theoretical concepts and learn laboratory
techniques, as well as methods for analyzing and presenting data. Lastly, the course
requires students to report preparation and the presentation of an oral technical report.
Even though this was mostly a laboratory class, equipment was in “very poor
condition,” to such a degree that “students often spend more time fixing the setups that
actually obtaining and analyzing data.” One respondent pointed out that this may have
been intentional to “gauge how well [students] adapt to problems as they arise,” but
failed to achieve even this objective, as the problems were associated with “basic
instruments.” The lab manual was also outdated and unhelpful.
One student praised the two TAs for being a “great benefit to the course” and
making the “laboratory run smoothly.”
Another student thought that 8 hours of class time a week was too much, and that
6 hours instead “would not likely change the quality of the students’ analysis or papers,
but would make the lab sessions significantly less trying.”
*This course review was written based on the 8 student comments received.

This course includes experimental studies in heat and mass transfer, separations
and chemical reactors to verify theoretical concepts and learn laboratory techniques.
Methods for analyzing and presenting data. Report preparation and the presentation of an
oral technical report.
Students complained about the bad quality of the lab equipment. One student
commented that the faulty equipment was a “significant detriment to the amount that [he]
learned.” Generally, students reflected that more time was spent on fixing equipment than
actually collecting reliable data. However, they appreciated the problem solving and
troubleshooting skills gained from the lab.
Overall, students felt that Professor Holleran was able to tie together previous
CBE concepts with lab material. Many students commented that reports should be graded
more quickly to gain some feedback for the course.
The course load for this class was quite heavy. In addition to the long hours inside
the lab, a lot of time was needed to finish lab reports. This class is recommended to
Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering majors only.
